org.openbel.framework.common.model
Class Statement

java.lang.Object
  org.openbel.framework.common.model.Statement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Term>, BELObject
public class Statement
extends Object
implements BELObject, Iterable<Term>

A statement is a specific assertion of a fact in some context: it is implicitly based on some source of knowledge, implicitly true in at least one specific situation.

BEL statements primarily represent relationships between terms. As such, statements are term-iterable: 

 
 for (final Term term : statement) {
     // ...
 }

Author:
Anthony Bargnesi <abargnesi@selventa.com>
See Also:

iterator

public Iterator<Term> iterator()
Returns an iterator over the document's terms.

The following code is guaranteed to be safe (no null pointer exceptions will be thrown): 

 
 for (final Term term : statement) {
 }

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Term>
Returns:
Iterator of terms

isSubjectOnly

public boolean isSubjectOnly()
Returns true if this statement only contains a subject term, false otherwise.

"In its simplest form, a BEL Statement can be used to establish that a BEL Term has been observed in the context of the BEL Statement. A typical example of such a statement would be one that contains a molecular complex term. Such a BEL Statement would assert that the complex has been observed."

For further reference, see BEL Language Overview, BEL Statements (BEL Overview).

Returns:
true if this statement only contains a subject term, false otherwise
See Also:
hasNestedStatement(), isStatementTriple()

isStatementTriple

public boolean isStatementTriple()
Returns true if this statement is a triple consisting of

TERM RELATIONSHIP TERM

Otherwise return false.

"Most BEL Statements represent relationships between one BEL Term and another BEL Term or BEL Statement. This type of BEL Statement encodes a semantic triple (subject, relationship type, object), which represents an assertion of a relationship between the subject and object."

For further reference, see BEL Language Overview, BEL Statements (BEL Overview).

Returns:
true if this statement is a term-rel-term triple, false otherwise
See Also:
hasNestedStatement(), isSubjectOnly()

hasNestedStatement

public boolean hasNestedStatement()
Returns true if this statement contains a nested statement of the form:

TERM RELATIONSHIP STATEMENT

"If the object of a BEL statement is another BEL statement, the BEL statement is said to be nested and the relationship type is constrained to the set of causal relationship types."

For further reference, see BEL Language Overview, BEL Statements (BEL Overview).

Returns:
true if this statement contains a nested statement, false otherwise
See Also:
isStatementTriple(), isSubjectOnly()

clone

public Statement clone()
Creates a clone of this BEL object and its state.
Implementations must ensure the clone is a deep copy.

This method should be used judiciously.

Specified by:
clone in interface BELObject
Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
BELObject clone, sharing no state with its source object
